page.title: 04Whitwell Colliery
page.content: Whitwell Colliery was started in 1890. 813 people work at the colliery, of which 250 come from Whitwell. 14,000 tonnes of stone are taken out of the colliery weekly.About half of the output each week goes to the power stations and the rest goes to industry.Lorries take coal to all parts of the country.The seams arein the concealed part of the Yorks. Derbys.Notts. coalfield. Measures are limited and the unconfirmed belief is that the pit will not be working in ten years time. The men work seven and a quarter hour shifts underground, and eight hours on the surface.The only complaints they receive are about the dust.The colliery has two clubs connected, which are the football and cricket club. One person has been killed underground in the last ten years.
